summary.para: The get_Interleaving method gets the audio preroll time and the frequency of interleaving for an AVI file.

param.name: prtInterleave
param.para: Receives the approximate duration of each interleaved group of audio or video chunks.

param.name: prtPreroll
param.para: Receives the amount of audio data, in 100-nanosecond units, that is written to the file before the first video frame.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The get_Mode method retrieves the interleaving quality setting.

param.name: pMode
param.para: Receives the interleaving quality, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The put_Interleaving method sets the audio preroll time and the frequency of interleaving for an AVI file.

param.name: prtInterleave
param.para: The approximate duration of each interleaved group of audio or video chunks, in 100-nanosecond units. The exact amount of interleaving is also affected by the interleave mode, which is specified by calling .

param.name: prtPreroll
param.para: The amount of audio data, in 100-nanosecond units, that is written to the file before the first video frame.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: An audio preroll of 750 milliseconds is recommended when authoring a file for distribution.
If you do not call this method, the default value for prtInterleave is 1000 milliseconds. The smaller the number, the larger the resulting file.

summary.para: The put_Mode method sets how audio samples and video frames are to be written to disk, by specifying quality of interleaving.

param.name: mode
param.para: Interleaving quality setting specified in the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The IConfigInterleaving interface controls how the AVI Mux filter interleaves audio and video samples. Video-authoring applications that handle capturing should use this interface when they need to control how audio samples and video frames will be saved on a disk.
